title: Aaron Ramsey declared UNFIT for Wales' crunch Euro 2020 qualifier against Croatia
text:
Aaron Ramsey has been declared unfit for Wales' Euro 2020 qualifier with Croatia in Group E.

The Juventus midfielder was left out of the travelling squad to Slovakia earlier in the week in a bid to try and regain full match fitness for the Sunday night match with Croatia in Cardiff.

The FAW posted to their social media: 'Aaron Ramsey has failed to regain match fitness in time for this evening's game and is not included in the match day squad.'

Aaron Ramsey's 11-month wait to play for Wales goes on after being declared unfit for Croatia

Wales are in need of a win in Group E as they are currently three points from the qualification spots with Croatia, Azerbaijan and Hungary left to play.

The news comes as a big blow to Ryan Giggs - who was hoping the 28-year-old would regain match fitness after not featuring for his national side for 11 months.

The midfielder has been a crucial part to the Welsh national team for years and adds a creative spark in the central-attacking midfield role.

Ramsey, 28, didn't travel to Slovakia in midweek in a bid to regain match fitness for Sunday

Ramsey made his international debut in 2008 and has made over 50 appearances since then and scored 14 goals.

It is likely that Charlton's Jonny Williams will play behind the striker in light of this news - after impressing against Slovakia on Thursday night.

Other than the ex-Arsenal man, Giggs has no fresh injury worries or suspensions to deal with and has, near enough, a full compliment of players to choose from.
